page.title: 01STUBHAMPTON BOTTOM AREA
page.content: Stubhampton Bottom is a steep sided valley about 3km long and heavily wooded. It lies about 8km SE of Shaftesbury and runs from NW to SE. The area surrounding Stubhampton Bottom is about 200m above sea-level and is bounded on the west by an escarpment overlooking the Blackmore Vale. It is a sparsely populated area given over to farming and woodland, and forms the western end of the historic hunting ground of Cranborne Chase. This unspoilt area of great natural beauty is rich in animal and plant life. No villages lie within yhe area but it includes parts of 5 parishes: Fontmell Magna, Sutton Waldron, Ashmore, Iwerne Minster and Tarrant Gunville. Stubhampton Bottom itself forms part of the boundary of each of the first four of these parishes.
